title: Grades 9-12: American Sign Language, Level III
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

D32622DE63794B1F822039A982C9E8C1.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the intermediate proficiency level for personal enrichment and career development.

89415543403D4DA7B28B8F93F2DABC49.description: use technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

19EA86C297DB407EBC3EDF2A85732FA1.description: apply ASL at the intermediate proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

46EFFFFB11AB45D18ABD9E61A584A068.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

FD9A10C66C914A0C821FFAF3B0AF9067.description: apply ASL at the intermediate proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

E414A1F2F2B5423B897ED89FFA737902.description: apply ASL at the intermediate proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

6A574B66AAB14266B04A07C72B889648.description: apply ASL at the intermediate proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

19CD5642DAD8479D9427B78946AA79E4.description: Comparisons. The student expands insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

BD8A9659EB58465FB2F7083EEC3B7AA1.description: apply ASL at the intermediate proficiency level to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

5042C54AAD9E49589141A6E0A407BB82.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to in-depth information about ASL and Deaf culture; and

D141E4EC489845009BCEF55F7F331958.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

8C0B4DFD888A4AD4B78FE11C391D7695.description: demonstrate an in-depth understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

F9C9B353CA0E46EDB56731ACDD60F6DD.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of the contributions to arts and sciences by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture; and

451D26963B774106834DB394C5047BDB.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

E11184C194494BF2840F0BDB8A7C9850.description: apply ASL to recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate an understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

7E9D9270C5914A4E8BC73DEDDE7371C4.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

A3F94D55E09446C1BD6FE44D7ECE27F4.description: create and express ASL literature, including handshape stories, that follows traditional cultural features.

901B8F4425154CFF8F843877459D1B55.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics at the intermediate proficiency level; and

E36C3F2D18D342B0A5495F3798C2FBFC.description: convey information in ASL using concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice at the intermediate proficiency level;

1C73D994EDAB4778BA461D5EAFBB9F91.description: demonstrate an understanding of ASL such as stories, commands, and instructions when dealing with familiar and less familiar topics;

A8587FF8107543598EB04B44E928B36A.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information at an intermediate proficiency level;

4650D876E3E74A84B1C33CFCED9CB555.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:
